title: Packers coach Matt LaFleur: Detroit Lions' Matthew Stafford 'an elite quarterback'
text:
CLOSE Debating how the Lions stack up in the NFC North, analyzing the offense and defense, and a key vs. the Packers, Oct. 9, 2019. Dave Birkett and Carlos Monarrez, Detroit Free Press

Tom Brady definitely is. Joe Flacco most certainly is not. And if you believe Green Bay Packers coach Matt LaFleur, Matthew Stafford is, too.

LaFleur, speaking in a conference call with Detroit reporters Thursday, said he considers Stafford among the elite quarterbacks in the NFL.

“Matthew Stafford, I think he’s an elite quarterback,” LaFleur said. “He’s a natural thrower. He’s extremely accurate and I’ve always – I haven’t really gone against him too many times on teams that I’ve been on but we all watch the same tape and he is just, I’ve always thought he is an elite quarterback.”

Stafford is off to a fine start this season, but 11 years into his NFL career, he’s rarely been called elite.

The Lions have had just four winning records in Stafford’s 10 seasons as quarterback and have never won a playoff game, though Stafford is on the verge of becoming the fastest quarterback in NFL history to reach 40,000 yards passing.

Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford and Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers chat before the game Oct. 7, 2018, at Ford Field. (Photo: Tim Fuller USA TODAY Sports)

LaFleur, a Michigan native who’s in his first year as Packers coach, said he defines an elite quarterback as “somebody that when he’s on your team you’re confident that you have a chance each and every week to go in and win the football game.”

Asked how many elite quarterbacks are in the NFL, LaFleur said, “I mean, I don’t know, to be honest with you. I know he’s one of them, though.”

Stafford has drawn high praise in recent days from not just LaFleur but others around the league.

Former NFL quarterback Carson Palmer said in an interview on "The Tiki and Tierney Show" this week that Stafford is “the most talented quarterback that I’ve ever seen and just doesn’t get his just due,” largely because he plays for the Lions.

"I think Matthew Stafford has more talent than most of the quarterbacks in the league not named Aaron Rodgers and (Patrick) Mahomes, but he plays for Detroit," Palmer said, via WXYT-FM (97.1). "The quarterback situation is so circumstantial, it’s so based on the organization. If you play for a good organization, you’re going to have a very, very successful career. If you play for a bad organization, it’s turnover and change and firing coaches and firing GM’s.

"Matthew Stafford has played for Detroit for too long and nobody knows he’s as good as he is because they don’t play on Monday Night Football multiple times a year and they don’t play a bunch on Sunday Night Football."

Detroit Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford passes against the Kansas City Chiefs during the first half Sunday, Sept. 29, 2019 at Ford Field. (Photo: Kirthmon F. Dozier, Detroit Free Press)

Stafford will share the spotlight with Rodgers this week when the Lions (2-1-1) play the Green Bay Packers (4-1) on Monday night in a clash of the two best teams in the NFC North.

The Lions have won two straight and three of their last four games in Lambeau Field, though Rodgers was knocked out of last year’s meeting with a concussion.

LaFleur, whose comments about Stafford were in response to a general question about the Lions offense, said his quarterback, Rodgers, a two-time MVP, falls into that elite category, too – something most NFL fans would agree with.

"Yeah, I feel like our guy’s pretty good," he said.

"There’s not a throw he can’t make. I mean, he is something special and I think just it’s so cool to see how he attacks every day and just how competitive he is. He’s just so in control at all times."

description: Green Bay Packers coach Matt LaFleur said he considers Detroit Lions QB Matthew Stafford among the elite quarterbacks in the NFL.
